thread.title: YouTuber calls out detox tea brand for Photoshopping their products into her photos
thread.title_full: YouTuber calls out detox tea brand for Photoshopping their products into her photos

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: YouTuber calls out detox tea brand for Photoshopping their products into her photos
text:
YouTuber, law graduate and Instagram star Pia Muehlenbeck has called out detox tea SkinnyMint Teatox after she noticed they were Photoshopping their products into her photos without permission.
There's been a lot of talk in the past about whether detox teas that are so readily promoted by minor celebrities are actually really harmful for you or if they interfere with the contraceptive pill working, but they've now been accused of false advertising after one influencer noticed they were editing their products into her pictures.
 Original photo pic.twitter.com/rCF8kNg1hN
â€” Pia Muehlenbeck (@piamuehlenbeck) February 20, 2017 Stolen photo with @SkinnyMintCom product photoshopped in to place. Obviously fake. pic.twitter.com/e8Jtv3vg3Q
â€” Pia Muehlenbeck (@piamuehlenbeck) February 20, 2017 Pia, who also owns lifestyle and yoga brand SLINKII Athletic, took to Twitter on Feb. 20 to call out a specific brand, SkinnyMint, for not only manipulating followers by editing their product into photos they don't own, but for making it look like she endorses the brand.
She wrote : "Here's another photo that @SkinnyMintCom have stolen and photoshopped (very badly) their tea in to place.
Here's another photo that @SkinnyMintCom have stolen and photoshopped (very badly) their tea in to place. pic.twitter.com/CyQIOQI8ha
â€” Pia Muehlenbeck (@piamuehlenbeck) February 20, 2017 "Stolen photo with @SkinnyMintCom product photoshopped in to place. Obviously fake. I want to call them out on my Instagram stories but don't want to give them the publicity. Unfortunately, they would probably actually get more sales if I made this IP theft more public.
"Imagine if I started photoshopping SLINKII yoga pants on to girls wearing other brands. Such a stupid business choice [sic]."
 I want to call them out on my Instagram stories but don't want to give them the publicity.
â€” Pia Muehlenbeck (@piamuehlenbeck) February 20, 2017 Unfortunately, they would probably actually get more sales if I made this IP theft more public.
â€” Pia Muehlenbeck (@piamuehlenbeck) February 20, 2017 Imagine if I started photoshopping SLINKII yoga pants on to girls wearing other brands. ðŸ˜‚ Such a stupid business choice.
â€” Pia Muehlenbeck (@piamuehlenbeck) February 20, 2017 As of yet, SkinnyMint Teatox is yet to publicly respond, but a number of other social media influencers and YouTubers replied to Pia's tweets, with one writing: "this is absolutely pathetic- not to mention illegal. Own up Skinny Mint- you f*cked up [sic]", and another adding: "wow this is unbelievable!! ow can they get away with that? X"
Interestingly, the photos have now seemingly disappeared from SkinnyMint Teatox's Instagram feed.
From: Cosmopolitan UK
